data.title: Speakers
data.meta_description: Gain insight from leading fleet operators and sustainable transportation experts at the Advanced Clean Transportation (ACT) Expo.
data.text:
Javier Garcia Atique is the Regional Head of Customer Delivery for Landside Transportation at A.P. Moller Maersk. He has been with Maersk for over 20 years, holding several leadership positions throughout North and South America before taking over COO responsibilities for the North American Warehousing and Distribution group.

In his current role, Javier is responsible for the rapid growth of transportation services with a commitment to both excellence and innovation in the evolving landscape of landside transportation. Under his leadership the team is leading the charge towards sustainability adding an electric vehicle fleet and building charging stations, all to support the goal to be an industry leader in the decarbonization of logistics.

Mainstage: Global Sustainability Trends in the Transportation Sector

Mathias Carlbaum is President and CEO of Navistar, Inc. and a member of the TRATON SE Executive Board.

As Navistar CEO, Carlbaum helped the company increase its market share in North America and increase profitability substantially since the merger. He also led the cultural integration into the TRATON GROUP post-merger.

Beyond leading the post-merger management of Navistar on behalf of the TRATON GROUP, Carlbaum has extensive experience in sales and international markets. For five years, he served as Executive Vice President, Commercial Operations of Scania CV AB in Södertälje, Sweden. In that role, Carlbaum managed support functions critical to sales and marketing efficiency.

In addition to his time at Scania in Sweden, Carlbaum worked as Sales and Marketing Director for both Scania Hispania and Scania Latin America. From there, he took on the role of Vice President, Sales and Marketing of Scania Latin America, before working as the Managing Director of Scania Iberica (Spain and Portugal) and Managing Director of Scania Brasil.

Carlbaum has a Master of Business Administration from Umea University in Sweden.

Mainstage: CEO Roundtable on Scaling Vehicle Electrification

John O’Leary, president and chief executive officer of Daimler Truck North America (DTNA), is responsible for all aspects of the company and its affiliated entities, including Freightliner, Western Star, Thomas Built Buses, Freightliner Custom Chassis Corporation (FCCC), and Detroit Diesel Corporation. He has been Member of the Board of Management of Daimler Truck Holding AG since December 1, 2021. He is also Member of the Board of Management of Daimler Truck AG.

Previously, O’Leary served as the chief transformation officer and Head of Mercedes-Benz Trucks in Germany, laying the foundation for its transformation and profitability improvement. Prior to that role, he served as the Chief Financial Officer of DTNA, directing operational and strategic controlling, treasury, accounting, tax, and IT functions for the company. O’Leary also previously served as the Senior Vice President of Aftermarket at DTNA, and as the president & CEO of Thomas Built Buses.

O’Leary has more than 30 years of experience in a wide variety of leadership and financial roles for truck and electronics manufacturers. He earned a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting at Seattle University, and he completed the Executive Program at Northwestern University’s Kellogg Graduate School of Management.

Mainstage: CEO Roundtable on Scaling Vehicle Electrification

Robert Sanchez is chairman and chief executive officer of Ryder System, Inc. (NYSE: R), a leading supply chain, dedicated transportation, and fleet management solutions company, responsible for the development and execution of Ryder’s growth strategy focused on the large segment of businesses that do not yet outsource their logistics operations.

Under his leadership as CEO since 2013, the company has achieved record revenue and earnings. Over the course of more than 30 years at Ryder, Mr. Sanchez has held many leadership positions including COO, CFO, and CIO.

Mr. Sanchez is on the board of directors of Texas Instruments. He earned his MBA from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania and a B.Sc. in Electrical Engineering from the University of Miami.

Mainstage Keynote: Fleet Electrification in the Real World – Keynote: Fleet Electrification in the Real World

Jason Skoog is the Peterbilt Motors Company General Manager and a Vice President of PACCAR Inc. He has been with the company for 30 years.

Jason began his career at PACCAR Financial as a Finance Associate. Over the next several years Jason worked his way through positions of increasing responsibility and in 2008 he became Director of Market Planning and Research for Kenworth Truck Company. In 2010 he returned to PACCAR Financial as Director of Operations and in 2012 went back to Kenworth as General Sales Manager. In 2015 Jason was promoted to Assistant General Manager – Sales & Marketing and in 2017 he became Assistant General Manager – Operations.

Since April 2018 Jason has been the General Manager for Peterbilt. He has led the company through a period of rapid expansion of the dealer network and unprecedented level of new product introductions, including the New Model 579, New Medium Duty lineup and, more recently, the Legendary Model 589.

Mainstage: CEO Roundtable on Scaling Vehicle Electrification

Andy Walz is president, Americas Products, a position he assumed in October 2019. He is responsible for optimizing Chevron’s fuels, base oils, and lubricants supply chains in North and Latin America, as well as the marketing, sale and delivery of Chevron and Texaco fuels brands and lubricants products that include the Havoline, Delo and Ursa brands.

In 2020 the renewables business unit was established under Americas Products to commercialize lower carbon products, including Renewable/Compressed Natural Gas, Hydrogen and Sustainable Aviation Fuel for transportation. This includes infrastructure development of compressed natural gas and hydrogen stations, renewable natural gas projects, and all joint venture management in the lower carbon space. In 2022 the Chevron REG business unit was established under Americas Products, responsible for feedstock aggregation, renewable manufacturing, and marketing lower carbon fuels.

Previously, Walz served as the president of International Products, responsible for Chevron’s downstream fuels business and joint ventures outside of the Americas. He oversaw the refining and marketing of transportation fuels for commercial and retail sales across four key distributive areas in Singapore, Thailand, Korea, and South Africa, as well as Chevron’s joint-venture aviation activities in the Middle East.

Walz has also served as vice president of Joint Ventures & Affiliates, responsible for Chevron’s non-operated joint venture refineries in Singapore, Thailand, and Korea. Prior to that role, he was the vice president of Product Supply and Trading, based in Houston Texas.

Walz graduated from Colorado State University with a degree in Civil Engineering. He joined Chevron in 1989 and has more than 30 years of experience in the oil and gas industry.

Over the course of his career, Walz has progressed through a series of leadership roles, including regional marketing manager Southeast U.S.; advisor to the president of Global Marketing in San Ramon, California; and general manager of the Burnaby Refinery in British Columbia, Canada. He also served as the general manager of Marketing for Caltex Australia Limited, based in Sydney, Australia, from 2008 to 2013.

Mainstage: Energy Transition Executive Roundtable: Navigating the New Fuel Frontier

Adam L. Wright serves as chief executive officer of Pilot Company. Headquartered in Knoxville, Tennessee, Pilot Company is majority-owned by Berkshire Hathaway and employs 30,000 team members.

Founded in 1958, Pilot Company has grown to become one of the leading suppliers of fuel and is the largest operator of travel centers in North America. The company supplies more than 14 billion gallons of fuel per year and has an industry-leading network of more than 870 fueling locations. With the third largest tanker fleet in North America, Pilot Company also provides end-to-end logistics solutions, gasoline, diesel and crude hauling, and saltwater disposal in the nation’s busiest oil production basins.

Adam Wright has over two decades of experience as a leader in the energy sector and brings expertise in strategic planning and operational excellence. Wright comes to Pilot after serving as chief operating officer of Pacific Gas & Electric Company, one of the nation’s largest combined natural gas and electric providers. Prior to that, he was president and CEO of Berkshire Hathaway-owned MidAmerican Energy Company which provides electric and natural gas service to nearly 1.6 million customers in Iowa, Illinois, Nebraska and South Dakota. In addition, the company owns and operates a diverse and growing portfolio of power generating assets, as well as an expanding transmission and distribution infrastructure.

Adam began his employment with the Berkshire Hathaway Energy family of businesses in 1996, and in 2003, he joined Northern Natural Gas. From 2003 to 2009, Adam served in various management roles within Northern Natural Gas’ operations group. From 2010 to 2011, Wright served as vice president of marketing, managing negotiation and execution of long-term service agreements and general customer satisfaction initiatives.

Adam earned his bachelor’s degree in civil engineering from the University of Nebraska at Omaha in 2002. He currently serves as a board member on the Iowa Business Council and the Iowa Utility Association and is an advisory director for the American Gas Association. Past board service includes in the American Gas Association, Governor Reynolds’ COVID-19 Economic Recovery Advisory Board, Rejuvi Ventures, LLC, John R. Grubb YMCA, The Science Center of Iowa, Tom Osborne’s Teammates, and the Hope Center for Kids.

Adam has been married to his wife Sabrina for 21 years and together they have two kids, Kenedy and Adam, who are both enrolled in college. Adam was an All-American running back for University of Nebraska at Omaha football from 1997-2000 and was a fullback on the New York Giants roster for the 2001 and 2002 seasons. He enjoys spending time with family and close friends, traveling, and audiobooks.

Mainstage Keynote

Nate Baguio has been working in the transportation industry for more than 30 years. His career has taken him from behind the wheel of a school bus to launching the largest deployment of heavy-duty electric vehicles in North America.

As Senior Vice President of Commercial Development, he is responsible for implementing business and public policy strategies for one of the nation’s leading electric vehicle (EV) manufacturers, the Lion Electric Company. Since joining Lion in 2018, he has helped position Lion as the leader in electric school bus deployments across target markets in the United States. Nate is at the forefront of advocating stakeholders and policy makers to invest and set regulations for the EV industry, and guide Lion to attain federal, state and local funding for Lion’s bus and truck lines. His work has contributed to the company’s exponential growth in the market and position as a policy leader in the EV industry.

Workforce Development Forum – Developing the Alternative Fuels Workforce

For over 25 years, Brad has been consistently engaged in alternative fuels and infrastructure projects, boasting more than 35 years of support for the automotive and vocational vehicle sectors. Brad’s involvement spans a wide array of Advanced Propulsion Technologies, ranging from early electric vehicles (EV1 and S10), 2-Mode and Hydraulic Hybrids, E85, Biodiesel, Propane, CNG, HCCI, and Hydrogen Fuel Cell vehicles. His rich experience encompasses direct collaboration with major OEMs, government, startups, as well as partnership programs and numerous component suppliers. This involvement extends to assisting with dealer setup, training, and support for sales and service. These endeavors led him to a role in GM’s R&D for the Project Driveway Fuel Cell program and his role as Project Officer for the US Department of Energy. During his tenure at Roush Clean Tech, Brad was instrumental in launching Blue Bird and Ford Propane offerings. More recently, he played a key role launching GM Brightdrop, as well as a product and marketing manager for the vocational Medium Duty vehicle space. Central to Brad’s approach is that “educational outreach in a wide variety of venues is the key to tracking toward success.”

Breakout Session: Achieving School Bus Fleet Electrification

Steve Bennett is a fourth-generation member of the Bennett family that founded Utility in 1914. Steve began his career while in school, working at the California factory and corporate office. He then became a salesman at the San Leandro, California dealership in 1989. After six years, Steve returned to corporate as the Western Division Sales Manager. Steve relocated to England in 1998 to be Managing Director of Utility International Limited and then later promoted to VP of European Sales and Marketing. When Steve returned to the states, he served as Vice President, responsible for various areas including purchasing, transportation, and aftermarket. In 2023, the fourth-generation took over new leadership roles for Utility where Steve currently serves as President & COO.

Thinking Outside the Cab: Innovative Ways to Lower Emissions – eTRU Technology and Real-World Applications

Jeremy’s passions have always centered around travel, adventure, tourism, and hospitality. Over the past 5 years, Jeremy’s intellectual curiosity and desire to affect both climate and industry change has led him to become a leader within the battery operated/EV world of mass-passenger transportation. Recently, MTRWestern, along with their partner FlixBus, became the first privately owned carrier in North America to operate a 100% battery-electric motor coach in an intercity/interstate fixed route service. As a leader in college and professional sports travel, MTRWestern was also the first company to carry professional teams (NHL) with a 100% battery-electric vehicle and over the course of our 1,700-mile journey, we were able to achieve 300+ mile legs.

Breakout Session: Zero Emission Transit Buses: Pioneering Sustainable Urban Commuting

Presentation Topic: Accelerating the Electric Bus EVolution: Paving a Path Through Partnership

With over 25 years of experience in the transportation ​industry, working on new and exciting technologies, along with ​a strong professional leadership and consulting career in both ​government and transportation, my background has led to a ​vast knowledge of various renewable and traditional energy ​solutions. I have had an extensive work history developing capital ​facility master plans, operational systems development, grant ​writing and organizational reviews.

I spent twenty years traveling the nation and the world, ​consulting within the public sector, working to improve the ​leadership of underperforming organizations. In my current ​position as the Executive Director of a nationally recognized ​transit agency, I have charted the course to be one of the first fully ​renewable transportation fleets in Washington state, using renewable ​energy electrification and hydrogen generation and fueling.

Breakout Session: Zero Emission Transit Buses: Pioneering Sustainable Urban Commuting

Presentation Topic: Green Hydrogen Production and Its Pivotal Role in Revolutionizing Public Transportation Fleets

In his 16+ years at Torc, Andrew has been instrumental in guiding the company’s strategy towards the commercialization of autonomous vehicles. He believes the fastest way to successful implementation is through collaboration and is responsible for identifying industries that share Torc’s mission of saving lives through self-driving technology. Andrew has created purposeful partnerships in markets that include trucking, mobility, mining, construction, and off-road vehicles.

Being a lifelong athlete in multiple sports and martial arts has taught Andrew you are only as successful as your team and has influenced our core value of Winning Teams. He is a frequent speaker who shares how self-driving technology can make transportation more accessible and efficient while improving the safety and quality of life across industries.

Vehicle Automation Workshop – Hitting the Road: Autonomous Vehicle Pilot Programs & Early-Stage Deployments

Presentation Topic: Collaborative Navigation: Deploying Autonomous Trucking Technology Successfully Together

With a broad range of engineering, sales and operations experience, Patrick Duan is Senior Vice President of Operations for BYD North America. He has played an integral role in bringing the global leader of battery electric technology to the United States and its continued growth in North America.

He joined BYD in 2004 as a Design Engineer, responsible for engine modeling and performance analysis for the firm’s Motor Development division. Two years later, Duan relocated to BYD North America offices in Chicago taking charge of BYD’s market sales of cell phone batteries and key accounts, as Project Manager and later Regional Manager. In 2012 Mr. Duan moved to the BYD North American Los Angeles headquarters as a Regional Sales Director for the coach and bus division, which is now the largest BYD group in the U.S.

In 2014, he was promoted to BYD’s Vice President of Operations for the North American headquarters, using his extensive engineering and management experience to oversee the corporate groups, and continue to expand the firm. In 2017, he also assumed the oversight of BYD’s SkyRail division for North America, the advanced monorail system.

Duan received his Mechanical Engineering degree from the Beijing Institute of Technology.

Battery Technology Advancements – Accelerating Electric Vehicle Manufacturing Capacity

Air Liquide is a pioneer in the hydrogen market, with over 60 years of experience across the entire hydrogen value chain, from production, distribution and storage, to the development of end-use applications. Air Liquide has invested more than $1 billion into hydrogen in the U.S., and more than $5 billion worldwide. It is committed to investing another $10 billion globally, in the entire low-carbon hydrogen value chain by 2035.

As head of Air Liquide Hydrogen Energy and Mobility in North America, Katie leads the growing and dynamic hydrogen energy team at the forefront of the highly competitive North American hydrogen mobility market.

Katie has 25 years of extensive experience in the chemical and oil and gas industries. She previously held senior leadership positions in the areas of strategic market development, business intelligence and brand strategy. Her last role before joining Air Liquide was vice president, Oilﬁeld Solutions, SI Group.

Hydrogen Workshop – Keynote: An Update on a $50 Billion Investment in Hydrogen Hubs

Presentation Topic: Scaling Up Hydrogen Production for Heavy-Duty Mobility in the US: A Strategic Imperative

Dawn Fenton is the Vice President for Government Relations and Public Affairs at Volvo Group North America. responsible for driving the company’s environmental and regulatory policy efforts in the U.S. and Canada. Prior to joining the Volvo Group Dawn worked for the Diesel Technology Forum and ABB, Inc. In addition to her role at the Volvo Group, Dawn serves as the Board Chair for Powering America’s Commercial Transportation (PACT), an industry consortium focused on accelerating utility infrastructure deployments for medium- and heavy-duty zero-emission vehicles. Dawn has worked in the government relations field for over 25 years across a range of energy, environment, sustainability, foreign policy and trade-related issues in the public, private and non-profit sectors. She received her master’s degree from the Georgetown University School of Foreign Service and her bachelor’s degree from Tufts University.

EV Charging Event – EV Charging Event Part 2a: The EV Charging Depot Ecosystem

Christina has been committed to working on innovative strategies towards a clean energy future. In her previous roles as the Executive Director of Empire Clean Cities, she advocated for policies and programs to decarbonize the transportation sector; and as a Business Developer in the private sector, build-out EV charging infrastructure networks across the US. In her current role at AVANGRID, she is engaged in utility programs to remove barriers for EV charging; enable the adoption of medium- and heavy-duty EVs; and the build out of the electric distribution system to support increased electrification. She holds a bachelor’s degree in biology from Boston University, a master’s degree in city and regional planning from the Pratt Institute, School of Architecture and Planning, and Certificate in Business Management from Columbia University.

Breakout Session: Achieving School Bus Fleet Electrification

Presentation Topic: Empowering NY School Bus Electrification; Utility Supported Fleet Transition

After college studies, I worked as an electrician in 1996, then as an apprentice in 1997. I became a superintendent from 2014 to 2017, and in 2018, I founded Fize Electrique. Starting with 2 employees, we now have 20. I held positions such as foreman, purchaser, and project manager. My interest in EVs began in 2012, and we acquired our first one in 2018. This sparked my passion for electrification. In 2019, I added the role of electrification advisor to my responsibilities. In 2021, I became the director of smart energy, leading the company to achieve 100% charging infrastructure by 2025, we did it at the end off 2022

EV Charging Event – EV Charging Event Part 1a: Light and Medium Duty Fleet Case Studies

Presentation Topic: Full EV Fleet

Illina Frankiv is the Head of Sustainability at Uber Freight, where she oversees the company’s efforts to build the industry’s leading zero emissions platform and move logistics to a greener future. She has a decade of experience spearheading sustainability programs across major enterprises. Prior to Uber Freight, Illina was WeWork’s Director of Energy and Sustainability.

Illina is also an advisor for the first-of-a-kind Environmental Council at the Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles. She held an Advisory Board position in the early days of the Clean Energy Buyers Association (CEBA), a community of energy buyers accelerating the zero-carbon energy future. She completed a Bachelor’s in Environmental Science and a Master’s in Environment and Sustainability from Western University. She has summited five of the seven tallest mountains on each continent.

ACT Shipper-Carrier Connect – Accounting for Sustainability Progress

Jim Gillis serves as the Pacific Region President at IMC, with his career in drayage spanning several critical hubs, including the Gulf and Pacific. Jim is known in the industry as the authority on California’s dynamic market and regulatory landscape, making him the expert in logistics and supply chain within the state. Jim’s forward-thinking strategy for sustainability and his blended approach to integrating both electric and hydrogen semi-truck technology is leading IMC toward a greener and more renewable future as a drayage carrier. Under his direction, the Pacific Region of IMC has grown to be the largest drayage provider in the state with over 500 trucks in the fleet in California servicing the West Coast.

Hydrogen Workshop – Hydrogen Vehicle Fleet Deployments

Thomas Healy is the Founder and CEO of Hyliion, a provider of innovative generator technology to produce clean, efficient and affordable electricity. A company focused on the global fight against climate change, Hyliion offers solutions that are fuel agnostic and pull forward the efficiency of powerplants, into a product that can be deployed on a localized level. Named one of Forbes’ “30 under 30” and the youngest public company CEO at the time, Healy took Hyliion public in 2020 and has raised over $750 million to date. As an entrepreneur, Healy has founded two start-ups prior to Hyliion while he was in college and holds over twenty patents. Healy’s passion for racing and motorsports inspired him to pursue dual engineering degrees in mechanical engineering and engineering & public policy from Carnegie Mellon University in 2014. He also started his masters in mechanical engineering at Carnegie Mellon but took a leave of absence to found Hyliion. In 2023, Healy joined the Board of Trustees of Carnegie Mellon University.

Utility Workshop – Finding Innovative Solutions to Power Constraints

Hernan Henriquez joined BayoTech in 2022 as Vice President of Sales. In this role, Mr. Henriquez is responsible for company revenues and for leading the BayoTech sales team. Hernan is an executive with a strong background in sales and marketing with expertise in the high-pressure transport industry.

Previously, he was the Senior Vice-President of Sales for Romeo Power, responsible for the global commercialization of battery technology into OEM’s in various vertical markets and end-users.

Prior to this he was the Sr. Vice-President of Sales at Romeo Power Executive and Vice-President of Business Development for Quantum Fuel Systems LLC. He started with the company in 2006 and held several positions in Sales, Marketing and Business Development for the commercialization of hydrogen, compressed natural gas and electric vehicle platforms.

Hydrogen Workshop – Producing and Delivering Hydrogen Fuel

Presentation Topic: Unlocking Off-Grid Electric Vehicle Charging with Hydrogen: A Sustainable and Resilient Solution

As CEO, Matt guides and supports a strong team of thinkers and doers dedicated to building and operating the critical infrastructure necessary to support the rapidly accelerating transition to electric vehicles. Under Matt’s leadership, Voltera is working hard to make zero-emission transportation a reality – at scale.

Matt comes to Voltera from Rivian (Nasdaq: RIVN), where he was the Executive Vice President of Energy & Charging Solutions. In this role, Matt was the executive responsible for the development and execution of Rivian’s business strategies for residential, charging network (Rivian Adventure Network and Waypoints Network) and fleet deployments, including sales, operations, maintenance, and field service. In addition, Matt’s team led product strategy for energy and charging hardware and software programs and was also responsible for the company’s renewable energy development and procurement activities.

Prior to his time at Rivian, Matt was Chief Commercial Officer at Proterra (Nasdaq: PTRA) where led the company’s brand, marketing, sales, and service activities. Under Matt’s leadership, Proterra led the development of the North American market for battery-electric transit vehicles and built one of the first large-scale fleet charging businesses in North America. Matt’s first leadership experience in clean transportation infrastructure was as CEO at Propel Fuels, a renewable fuels retailer building alt-fuels infrastructure. Matt was also an early investor in the clean energy economy, working in venture capital for nearly 10 years before beginning his executive career.

When he’s not at work building innovative EV charging companies, Matt enjoys outdoor adventures with his family in the mountains of California and beyond. He remains active in the cleantech startup community, including as a mentor and an investor.

EV Charging Event – EV Charging Event Part 2a: The EV Charging Depot Ecosystem

Presentation Topic: Delivering Power to Electric Drayage Fleets: Voltera and Einride

With over 10 years of experience in the electric vehicle (EV) industry, Charlie is passionate about creating a sustainable future for our planet. He is the founder and CEO of EO Charging, a company that specializes in charging solutions for electric van, truck, bus and car fleets.

At EO Charging, Charlie leads a team of talented and passionate individuals who share his vision and values. EO Charging has grown from a small startup to a global leader. They have partnered with some of the world’s largest companies, such as Amazon, DHL, UPS, Tesco and GoAhead Group; helping them electrify their fleets and reduce their carbon footprint. EO has been recognized as one of Europe’s fastest growing companies (Financial Times) and is backed by Private Equity investors, Zouk Capital and Vortex Energy (part of EFG Hermes). Charie has also been lucky enough to be made a Forbes 30 under 30.

EV Charging Event – EV Charging Event Part 1a: Light and Medium Duty Fleet Case Studies

Presentation Topic: Achieving 99% Uptime at Scale: An EO Charging and Amazon Case Study

Puneet is the General Manager of the global Spark Ignited and Fuel Delivery System business for Cummins Inc. In this role, he is responsible for the global natural gas, Propane, Octane business and fuel delivery system; including product vision, competitive positioning, financial management and overall performance of the spark ignited and fuel delivery system business across global markets.

Over his 15-year career at Cummins, Jhawar has been focused on helping customers achieve their success and he has managed successful relationships with several Cummins’ largest global customers. His leadership has fueled growth of Cummins’ natural gas business in key markets. Jhawar has extensive work experience, with roles based in the Middle East, India, Europe and the US. Jhawar has implemented important new programs for Cummins, including the introduction of the Cummins fuel system on the B-platform for the first time.

Hydrogen Workshop – The Current Landscape for Heavy-Duty Hydrogen Vehicles

Presentation Topic: The Business Case for Hydrogen ICE

Henry Johnson is the Global Product Manager for Truck and Bus applications at Alpitronic, a global leader in DCFC charging infrastructure. He focuses on developing the most customer-oriented solutions for commercial vehicles to help accelerate the industry’s shift to a sustainable future.

Henry previously spent 10 years working at Daimler Truck in Germany and Japan where he was the lead for charging infrastructure. Through the company’s global reach, he was in regular contact with their offices in Portland which helped him build an understanding of the US market.

Although Henry is the proud owner of a European CDL, he must make do with a Hyundai Ioniq 6 for his commute between the Alpitronic offices in south Germany and north Italy.

Innovative Tech Showcase, featuring the EV Charging Event – EV Charging Event: Explore the Codes and Standards Shaping the Industry

Presentation Topic: The Advent of Megawatt Charging

Tim has worked in various sectors of the automotive and fleet industry for the last 20 years. He currently serves as a business process manager for US Foods’ Fleet and Sustainability team overseeing the standardization of fleet processes to improve the safety, reliability, and efficiency of their fleet. He has supported various emissions reductions initiatives, regulatory compliance, and the rollout of their first electric tractors. Tim is passionate about sustainability, process improvement, and efficiency using data. Tim has held various roles in automotive repair, management, and the insurance space after earning his B.S. in Automotive Technology from Weber State. All his professional work supports his active involvement and passion for the outdoor community in Colorado, which relies on environmental sustainability.

Utility Workshop – Finding Innovative Solutions to Power Constraints

Julia Levin is an attorney and expert on energy and climate policy. She has served as the Executive Director of the Bioenergy Association of California (BAC) since its founding in 2012. Prior to BAC, Julia served as the Deputy Secretary for Climate Change and Energy at the California Natural Resources Agency where she chaired the Governor’s Bioenergy Working Group and led development of California’s 2012 Bioenergy Action Plan. Julia has also served as a Commissioner on the California Energy Commission, where she led the Commission’s work on renewable energy and energy efficiency. Previously, Julia worked for the National Audubon Society, the Union of Concerned Scientists, the World Bank, and the U.S. Agency for International Development. Julia has a B.A. from Brown University and a law degree from the University of California, San Francisco.

Thinking Outside the Cab: Innovative Ways to Lower Emissions – Achieving Sustainability with eFuels and Renewable Fuels

Ian MacDonald boasts over 23 years of experience in engineering and commercial roles, primarily within the automotive and commercial vehicle sectors. Prior to joining Hexagon Agility in 2017, Ian served as Vice President of Technical Sales and Business Development at Clean Diesel Technologies, Inc., a company specializing in vehicle emissions control products.

Prior to this, he served as Vice President of Sales & Marketing at Engine Control Systems Ltd., which was later acquired by Clean Diesel Technologies, Inc. Ian joined Engine Control Systems, Ltd. in 1997 as a Technical Support Engineer, advancing through various roles and contributing to significant revenue growth, ultimately leading to its acquisition. Ian holds a Bachelor of Engineering Science (B.E.Sc.) in Chemical and Biochemical Engineering from the University of Western Ontario and is a member of the Professional Engineers of Ontario.

Thinking Outside the Cab: Innovative Ways to Lower Emissions – Achieving Sustainability with eFuels and Renewable Fuels

Andy has been in EV Infrastructure for over 10 years with experience in EV Charging and Renewable Fleet Transportation. Beginning as a consultant to Tesla on their destination and super charging networks with a focus on the Southeast, Bay Area, and Eastern Canada, Andy then transitioned to Greenlots. At Greenlots (now Shell Recharge Solutions), Andy led the East Coast Operations, and backfilled roles in Health and Safety, O&M, Product Development, leading the Infrastructure Solutions Team focusing on CaaS Solutions and Professional Services. At Prologis, he built out the infrastructure solutions team, providing Sales Engineering and Project Development support to the Prologis Mobility team. Prologis Mobility focuses on deploying charging infrastructure to support the Zero Emissions transition of fleets, with a “Charging as a Service” model including Real Estate, Infrastructure, Operations and Maintenance, and Energy holistically bundled into a per kWh fee.

EV Charging Event – EV Charging Event Part 1a: Light and Medium Duty Fleet Case Studies

Over a 24-year career with Walmart, Ryan has demonstrated a keen ability to position Walmart’s Supply Chain as a competitive advantage throughout the world. Ryan’s personal beliefs and open leadership style align well with Walmart’s culture and have allowed him to deliver consistent and sustainable results. As Vice President, Ryan leads Domestic Transportation for the West Division of Walmart US. His team is comprised of nearly 7,500 Walmart Private Fleet Drivers who deliver products to Walmart Stores and Sam’s Clubs, enabling customers and members to save money and live better.

Ryan joined Walmart in May 2000. He led cross-functional change initiatives within the Walmart US Supply Chain for over nine years, implementing large-scale capital projects in various networks such as apparel, imports, general merchandise, and returns.

Innovative Tech Showcase, featuring the EV Charging Event – End-to-End: Walmart’s Approach to Transitioning the Middle and Last Mile Fleet

Propulsion Québec’s CEO, Michelle LLambías Meunier, previously served as the Vice President of Public Affairs and Government Relations at SYRUS, a consulting firm. In this role, she assisted various clients in aligning their business strategies with stakeholders. Prior to that, she spent eight years at the Chamber of Commerce of Metropolitan Montreal as the Vice President of Public and Corporate Affairs.

During her tenure, she held various positions, including overseeing government relations, media relations, board of directors relations, and projects involving multiple external partners.

Throughout her career, Michelle has worked as a Press attaché, as a researcher at Radio-Canada’s radio station, and as a Communications and Media Relations Manager at the Old Brewery Mission Foundation.

Michelle has also served on different boards of directors and committees, such as YMCA Quebec, the Quartier des spectacles Partnership and the advisory committee of Montreal Airport. She is currently a board member of the Association of Consulting Engineering Firms of Quebec.

Battery Technology Advancements – The State of the Reuse, Recycling, and the Used Electric Vehicle Markets

Zach Miller is the Director of Metro Region Operations for the Trucking Association of New York (TANY). He previously served as the Metro Region Vice-Chair for TANY on the Board of Directors. He also served as the head of Media and Business Development at TruckTractorTrailer.com and co-founded NewYorkTruckStop.com. Zach completed his BBA in Business Administration from Hofstra University and is a proud graduate of the TANY Leadership program. He is recipient of TANY’s Outstanding Service Award and was recognized as one of City & State’s Responsible 100. A lifelong New Yorker, he is a long-suffering fan of the New York Mets and New York Jets.

Regulatory Workshop – Understanding the Spread of California’s Zero Emission Regulations

Steven Moelk is the Project Manager in the U.S. for the IKEA Zero Emission Delivery initiative. In this role, he is responsible for ensuring IKEA Retail U.S. fulfills its commitment to ultimately provide zero-emission home deliveries to all its customers.

Prior to IKEA, Mr. Moelk worked in the final mile segment of the logistics industry. In 2001, he helped form Urban Express, New York’s largest same day delivery service. He became the company’s CEO in 2008. Rebranded as UX Specialized Logistics – the company expanded across the US and Canada, and became the largest home delivery provider for IKEA in North America. In 2015, UX was sold to XPO Logistics, where Mr. Moelk worked to expand XPO’s home delivery services.

EV Charging Event – EV Charging Event Part 1a: Light and Medium Duty Fleet Case Studies

Jerrod Mounce serves as Vice President of Energy and Sustainability for J.B. Hunt Transport Services, Inc. He leads the company’s efforts in the areas of alternative power vehicles, emissions regulation compliance, energy procurement, and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) disclosures. Jerrod has 25 years of experience at J.B. Hunt with a background in operations, engineering, and finance. He and his team work closely with the company’s sales force and their customers to produce solutions toward shippers’ greenhouse gas reductions targets in transportation. In 2022, Jerrod and his team established the company’s first formal emissions reduction target. Relying on a combination of increased diesel efficiency, biogenic fuels, and the incorporation of zero emission trucks, J.B. Hunt seeks to reduce scope 1 and 2 greenhouse gas intensity by 32% by the year 2034.

ACT Shipper-Carrier Connect – Planning for Sustainability and Clean Tech Adoption

Ed Munar is the Sr. business development manager at BorgWarner charging solutions. He has 30+ years of experience in the technology space focused on EV charging, power electronics, power distribution, energy storage, and semiconductors.

Ed has worked for BorgWarner since 2017 (formerly Rhombus Energy Solutions) and helped develop BorgWarner’s EV charging business. In the early years, he helped established its first EVSE clients and developed its initial technology partnerships. Currently, he manages key client relationships including OEM, CaaS, TaaS, and V2G partnerships.

Ed has held senior roles in management – sales, product management, and business development across various industries. Ed earned his BS from the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA), Samueli School of electrical engineering and an international master’s in business administration (IMBA) from the University of San Diego, Knaus School of Business.

Lauren is passionate about providing industry-leading solutions for customers both now and in the future, and leads her team to provide the strategy for on highway, heavy duty vocational, medium duty products, safety systems as well as propulsion technologies.

Lauren joined DTNA in 2012 and has held various management positions within the group focused on technical product development joined with customer and market insights, including roles in Germany and Japan.

Lauren has a bachelor’s degree in Economics and German from Willamette University.

Erika Myers is committed to decarbonizing the world’s transportation systems. She serves as the Executive Director of CharIN North America, the non-profit trade association dedicated to accelerating EV adoption by advocating for universal interoperable charging standards.

Myers guides the association’s activities throughout North America and engages with members, industry, governments, and other stakeholders, and focuses on the use of open standards and interoperability for public infrastructure investments.

Before joining CharIN, Myers was the Director of Global eMobility for the World Resources Institute, the Principal of Transportation Electrification for the Smart Electric Power Alliance, and an alternative fuels and clean energy consultant with ICF International.

Bob has more than 30 years of experience working in the fleet asset management field. His perspective comes from both the public and private sector, where he developed an extensive and comprehensive understanding of State and Federal highway equipment guidelines, policies, and standards.

Bob is responsible for the overall management of the Caltrans’ fleet, which consists of approximately 12,000 units. He determines how to allocate a $400M budget, which is used to build, maintain, purchase, optimize, and dispose of fleet assets used by Caltrans’ employees to provide a safe and reliable transportation network. This includes transitioning the Caltrans’ fleet to zero-emission, with the goal of becoming the greenest fleet in the nation.

With over a decade of experience in the transportation industry, Narayanan has held various roles throughout Daimler Truck, including Product Development Engineer for Mercedes-Benz Trucks, EvoBus, and DTNA and Engineering Manager for Detroit Assurance Safety Suite. Kim also leads the acquisition of grant funds for the organization. Under Kim’s leadership, Trillium and Love’s have increased its hydrogen portfolio to 5 fueling stations, it’s EV charging portfolio to over 230 ports, and acquired over $40M in grants funds.

Kim also actively serves on the Board of Directors for the California Hydrogen Business Council and has an Electrical Engineering degree from the University of Houston. Tom Pacheco is a leader in alternative fuels workforce development at the Colorado Department of Transportation (CDOT). Tom has over 30 years’ experience in the fleet and automotive industry.

At CDOT, he leads programs to upskill technicians and works with schools to develop pathways for students to enter the clean transportation workforce. Tom’s passion lies in ensuring a skilled workforce can safely maintain and repair the future of transportation.

Chanel Parson is responsible for progressing SCE’s vision for a Clean Energy Future through accelerating the adoption of electric vehicles, solar, and battery storage while also supporting grid resiliency through managing and maintaining strong demand response programs. Tucker Perkins is the president and CEO of the Propane Education & Research Council (PERC), a Washington D.C.-based nonprofit which invests in the research and development of propane-powered innovation, and promotes the safe, efficient use of propane through safety training and education programs. Perkins joined PERC in 2015 as Chief Business Development Officer and was promoted to Chief Operating Officer before the Council named him President and CEO in 2018. A Virginia Tech graduate in civil engineering, Perkins earned his MBA from the University of Richmond. Perkins is a dynamic and relatable leader who has amplified propane’s voice in the national energy conversation as a frequent keynote speaker on energy-related topics. Tucker is also host of the podcast, Path to Zero, in which he engages energy thought leaders in provocative discussions regarding energy and the environment and the path to zero carbon emissions.

Regulatory Workshop – Navigating Regulatory Compliance

With over 25 years of expertise in the automotive industry, Rashid is currently serving as the Engineering Director at Schaeffler Group, a global leader in motion and innovative engineering solutions. As the leader of the Schaeffler Corporate Competency Center of Americas, he leads a dynamic team of scientists and engineers. Their primary focus is advancing automotive energy technologies, particularly innovations in next-generation energy storage, including solid-state batteries, fuel-cell systems, and green hydrogen.

In addition to his responsibilities at Schaeffler, Rashid plays a pivotal role in fostering impactful collaborations between industry and academia. One notable initiative is his leadership of the Schaeffler Hub for Advanced Research (SHARE) at Ohio State University, where he actively nurtures an environment for innovation and knowledge exchange between academic staff and engineering professionals. This hub is dedicated to bridging advanced scientific concepts with practical engineering applications.

Rashid’s academic achievements are equally commendable. He holds a doctorate in Mechanical Engineering and contributes to the academic community as an Adjunct Professor and Engineering advisory board member at the University of Akron. In summary, Rashid emerges as an entrepreneurial leader capable of assembling a team to transform advanced scientific concepts into final production reality.

Outside work, Rashid is an avid skier and holds the highest leadership and technical level in the National Ski Patrol, Certified Patroller #801.

Tracee Scott is the Fleet and Fuel Services Manager for the City of Las Vegas. She joined the City of Las Vegas in 2006 as their Superintendent of Field Operations and in 2013 became their Fleet and Fuel Services Manager.

Fleet and Fuel Services is responsible for the acquisition, maintenance, repair, and disposal of the approximately 1,700 (and growing) vehicles and equipment. Fleet also maintains the 18 City of Las Vegas fuel sites where all city fleet assets refuel, of which 14 are located at City of Las Vegas Fire Stations. Fleet has two maintenance yards where vehicle repair takes place with staff that includes, services writers, vehicle parts inventory specialists, fleet service workers, mechanics, heavy mechanics, a fleet coordinator, a courier, and management analyst. Dakota Semler is the Chief Executive Officer of Xos, a Los Angeles-based manufacturer of Class 5 through Class 8 battery-electric vehicles and fleet services provider. Xos’ mission is to decarbonize commercial transportation with the most durable trucking technology available. Dakota has been in the transportation and trucking industry for more than a decade and grew up working in his family’s fleet business. He came up with the idea for Xos to solve the exact challenge he faced as a fleet operator: to create a cost-effective, durable, and reliable electric vehicle that achieves the same, or better, performance benchmarks of an existing diesel vehicle—without compromising the air we breathe. Since 2018, Xos has deployed hundreds of its 100% battery-electric vehicles with leading fleets within parcel delivery, cash-in-transit, beverage distribution, and linen and textile services. Dakota was named in the Forbes 30 Under 30 in Manufacturing & Industry In 2019.

Darryl is currently the Fleet Management Division Chief for the City of Alexandria Va. working to execute the cities sustainability policy along with developing and managing the Division budget; planning and managing replacement programs and establishment/maintenance of Division policies, procedures, and guidelines.
